comments: When n is odd, a(n) ends in 1, and when n is even, a(n) ends in 2, since 2^n is congruent to 1 mod 3 when n is odd and to 2 mod 3 when n is even. (From _Alonso del Arte_ Dec 11 2009)Sloane (1973) conjectured a(n) always has a 0 between the most and least significant digits if n > 15. This has been verified up to n = 10^5 (see A102483). (From Alonso del Arte, Feb 20 2011)
references: Sloane, N. J. A. "The Persistence of a Number." J. Recr. Math. 6 (1973): 97 - 98
